name: Acid
description: Acids are substances which increase the acidity of a foodstuff and/or impart a sour taste to it.

name: Acidity regulator
description: Acidity regulators are substances which alter or control the acidity or alkalinity of a foodstuff.

name: Anti-caking agent
description: Anti-caking agents are substances which reduce the tendency of individual particles of a foodstuff to adhere to one another.

name: Anti-foaming agent
description: Anti-foaming agents are substances which prevent or reduce foaming.

name: Antioxidant
description: Antioxidants are substances which prolong the shelf-life of foods by protecting them against deterioration caused by oxidation, such as fat rancidity and colour changes.

name: Bleaching agent
description: A food additive -non-flour use- used to decolourize food. Bleaching agents do not include pigments.

name: Bulking agent
description: Bulking agents are substances which contribute to the volume of a foodstuff without contributing significantly to its available energy value.

name: Carbonating agent
description: A food additive used to provide carbonation in a food.

name: Carrier
description: A food additive used to dissolve, dilute, disperse or otherwise physically modify a food additive or nutrient without altering its function -and without exerting any technological effect itself- in order to facilitate its handling, application or use of the food additive or nutrient.

name: Colour
description: Colours are substances which add or restore colour in a food, and include natural constituents of foods and natural sources which are normally not consumed as foods as such and not normally used as characteristic ingredients of food.

name: Emulsifier
description: Emulsifiers are substances which make it possible to form or maintain a homogenous mixture of two or more immiscible phases such as oil and water in a foodstuff.

name: Emulsifying salts
description: Emulsifying salts are substances which convert proteins contained in cheese into a dispersed form and thereby bring about homogenous distribution of fat and other components.

name: Firming agent
description: Firming agents are substances which make or keep tissues of fruit or vegetables firm or crisp, or interact with gelling agents to produce or strengthen a gel.

name: Flavour enhancer
description: Flavour enhancers are substances which enhance the existing taste and/or odour of a foodstuff.

name: Flour treatment agent
description: Flour treatment agents are substances, other than emulsifiers, which are added to flour or dough to improve its baking quality.

name: Foaming agent
description: Foaming agents are substances which make it possible to form a homogenous dispersion of a gaseous phase in a liquid or solid foodstuff.

name: Gelling agent
description: Gelling agents are substances which give a foodstuff texture through formation of a gel.

name: Glazing agent
description: Glazing agents -including lubricants- are substances which, when applied to the external surface of a foodstuff, impart a shiny appearance or provide a protective coating.

name: Humectant
description: Humectants are substances which prevent foods from drying out by counteracting the effect of an atmosphere having a low degree of humidity, or promote the dissolution of a powder in an aqueous medium.

name: Packaging gas
description: A food additive gas, which is introduced into a container before, during or after filling with food with the intention to protect the food, for example, from oxidation or spoilage.

name: Preservative
description: Preservatives are substances which prolong the shelf-life of foods by protecting them against deterioration caused by micro-organisms and/or which protect against growth of pathogenic micro-organisms.

name: Propellent gas
description: Propellants are gases other than air which expel a foodstuff from a container.

name: Raising agent
description: Raising agents are substances or combinations of substances which liberate gas and thereby increase the volume of a dough or a batter.

name: Sequestrant
description: Sequestrants are substances which form chemical complexes with metallic ions.

name: Stabiliser
description: Stabilisers are substances which make it possible to maintain the physico-chemical state of a foodstuff; stabilisers include substances which enable the maintenance of a homogenous dispersion of two or more immiscible substances in a foodstuff, substances which stabilise, retain or intensify an existing colour of a foodstuff and substances which increase the binding capacity of the food, including the formation of cross-links between proteins enabling the binding of food pieces into re-constituted food.

name: Sweetener
description: Sweeteners are substances used to impart a sweet taste to foods or in table-top sweeteners.

name: Thickener
description: Thickeners are substances which increase the viscosity of a foodstuff.
